topic.title: Syncing multiple machines
topic.body: Hi, I use zeroNet on different machines with the same ID by copying users.json. But the problem is that each machine only shares what i visited on it and don't sync with the other ones. Is there a way to keep my machines in sync together through  ZeroNet ?

7_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ.body: I loved KAT for the  bookmarking system it had and the medals. Give me that easy and clear bookmarking and i'm your slave forever  lol

guys, the size limit can be changed easily by holding the zero button on top right and drag it to let it will open a side panel where you can find size limit and other configs, I update it to 20, 30 ,or 50Mb for the sites i'm seeding. I'm planning to have a separate unit with a 3TB hard drive just for ZeroNet that I can access on the LAN so it can be up all the time and not interfering with the work on the actual machine.

> [kickasstorrents](#comment_12_1D6Pn4487L8QyFtVSU14nxxtnfEgEs2Ny1): By "size limit" they meant the size limit for uploading content not downloading, there's a fixed limit for each user to prevent spam. This sounds great until users legitimately reach this limit and cannot post anymore. This is a problem that needs to be overcome one way or another.

I fail to see how it can prevent spam. If someone uses a bot to spam on the network, they also can program it to change the size limit.

8_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ.body:
Red Hub & Blue Hub ! is it a reference to Red pill & Blue pill ?
If so, what reality and illusion are we dealing with. Is it about revealing who we are on Red or staying anonymous on Blue ?

> [anonnas](#comment_2_13zDA1QLNorSNQRyEN2boe4r9TCc81atQV): maybe its a reference to pokemon red/blue :P

pokemon have red/blue/green - ingress have blue/green :P

> [kaffie](#comment_140_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Pokemon Go and the US release of the original is red/blue/yellow. Green is more or less just blue.

So , any idea about Red/Blue hubs ?

> [kaffie](#comment_142_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): There's no difference between the hubs. They're just two separate hubs to demonstrate the merger site feature. Red/Blue are just standard primary colors that likely don't refer to anything.

all right . thnx

1_1P6rReMY7WD7qNmUXntLJoa1XptgiHkhz3.body: your search engine for available zites http://127.0.0.1:43110/kaffiene.bit/

2_13WWWFi6iuSLazDcNvHgBEjjeAofAhAwtE.body:
> [arendeiro](#comment_4_16XR1GVbekHSMMoUZ5pTQWFpq2anbkHgrC): rsync?

that will need the computers to be connected at the same time which is not the case often + stupidly slow internet.
one is a Windows machine at work and the second is a linux machine at home. the 3rd will be a virtual machine on an openmediavault server.

2_163sF1Kdsd5LdpjAXDKBshdEBNJH6PUqvg.body: isn't it just easier to copy the whole zerobundle directory and call it a day?

1_19TgPhgpi9U73U9jQWUSspfxy8vbPjUxVT.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_164_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Kaffiene Search Engine.

came here to mention that too

1_1PRsmkcDcCnKbCfFTeQizKYcDpNn98iQcT.body: I don't speak Japanese but I would love to learn it. can this be a learning platform with the help of users ? If yes, i'll try to be here as much as i can

3_1MDjoCqFDeRHGESqDBF8oGhG3ZjCdVo8pr.body: hmm  ... it sounds like we need a kind of WHOIS for ZN . @kaffie what do you think ?
